quest.name: Confessions of a Flaming Mongrel
journal: Radovan is hoping for a nice, straightforward, no-strings-attached assignment.

Radovan is pleased to inform you that the Yellowjackets are in need of bodyguards. Considering the unforeseen difficulties with your previous client, an assignment with as few surprises as possible would be most welcome. To ascertain exactly what this job entails, you will need to speak with Futag Yafutag at Bulwark Hall.

The Yellowjacket Futag Yafutag gives a brief outline of your mission, revealing that the person you will be protecting is Guldweitz, former head of the much reviled Flaming Mongrels. While Radovan and Sophie both have reservations about guarding a notorious criminal, Futag explains that the pirate has handed himself in and wishes to testify, implicating countless members of Limsa Lominsa's underworld. Naturally, there are many who would prefer that Guldweitz's silence be made a permanent arrangement, meaning that the assignment to escort him from the Moraby Drydocks is a particularly dangerous one. After Futag departs, Radovan points out the risks of relying solely on the information provided by the client, and suggests asking the Lominsan citizens about Guldweitz and the Flaming Mongrels.

The information you glean from the locals correlates with that of your client. Guldweitz and his gang are believed to have had a hand in almost every case of extortion, with their moneylenders preying on businesses and individuals throughout the city. Many citizens would be glad to see Guldweitz behind bars or even executed for his crimes, and it is plain to see that the man has no shortage of enemies.
It appears that Guldweitz is exactly as your client has described, if not worse. Satisfied that the assignment is above board, Radovan suggests proceeding to the agreed meeting place.

Futag brings out Guldweitz, his prisoner, although it is hard to believe that this forlorn old man could be the criminal mastermind who has terrorized Limsa Lominsa. Before your arrival, the Yellowjackets have scouted the proposed route and have spotted what they believe to be an ambush. You are tasked with leading the way and drawing out the enemy, clearing a path for your comrades while they escort Guldweitz.
Dispatching the assailants proves to be a remarkably simple affair. As instructed, you head towards Oschon's Embrace to await the arrival of Guldweitz and his custodians.

Immediately after reaching the rendezvous point, another Yellowjacket arrives to report that the rogues you neutralized were only lookouts, with the real ambush awaiting further along your route. She also explains that Futag has been ordered to return to his post, while she is charged with moving Guldweitz to a more secure location until the enemies lying in wait can be eliminated. Though Futag is clearly displeased with the sudden turn of events, he reluctantly informs you, Radovan, and Sophie that your contract has been fulfilled and that your services are no longer required. Radovan, on the other hand, refuses to leave the job half-finished and chases after Guldweitz's newly assigned escort.

Radovan has followed the Yellowjacket to an isolated mining tunnel, and rushes inside to find that she is preparing to behead Guldweitz. She questions why Radovan is denying her vengeance for her friend's death, for which she holds Guldweitz responsible. Radovan states that he gave his word to protect him and that the prisoner is acting for the good of Limsa Lominsa. The Yellowjacket, swayed by this reasoning, lowers her axe and is placed under arrest by Futag, who arrives just in time to witness the aftermath of this unfortunate incident. Your mission, despite being severely waylaid, resumes as per your original instructions, but before you leave, Guldweitz expresses his gratitude to Radovan. After discovering that he is suffering from an incurable disease, Guldweitz came to the realization that people like him are reason why so many Lominsans are dragged into a life of crime. By removing himself and the ones he would implicate from circulation, he hopes to tip the scales in the favor of law and order. These words give you and your friends food for thought as you continue the journey to Limsa Lominsa.

Now that Guldweitz has been delivered to the Lominsan authorities, Radovan has fulfilled his promise. The time has come for you to travel to pastures new, and having visited Gridania, Ul'dah, and Limsa Lominsa, the most likely candidate would be the snow-blasted peaks of Ishgard, much to Sophie's obvious displeasure.

Sophie is clearly unused to such inclement conditions, and even a change into warmer attire does little to alleviate her discomfort. Radovan has, in the absence of an Adventurers' Guild, made inquiries with the Temple Knights in the hope of finding clients in need of bodyguards.

※The next gunbreaker quest will be available from Radovan upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Speak with Futag Yafutag at Bulwark Hall.
Speak with locals around the Octant.
Speak with Futag Yafutag at the Moraby Drydocks.
Survey the designated location and defeat the assailants.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Radovan didn't seem too impressed by the idea of going for a swim at Costa del Sol. You don't suppose he's scared of water, do you?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Litany of Peace.”

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: You'll be pleased to hear that the Yellowjackets have offered us an assignment.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: After taking on more than we'd bargained for with our previous clients, we're hoping this one will turn out to be relatively straightforward. We haven't heard what it entails yet, but I'll bet it's something important.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: A man called Futag Yafutag has arranged to meet us in Bulwark Hall. Let's go and see what he wants.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: So, these Yellowjackets uphold the law? I imagine they have their work cut out for them around here.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Their uniform seems a bit billowy for my tastes, but I do like the color.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming at such short notice. Time is of the essence, so I'll be brief. We want you to protect Guldweitz, who was until recently leader of the Flaming Mongrels.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: They were once a gang of raiders, but eventually settled in Limsa Lominsa to extort and rob their way to a position of considerable influence in the criminal underworld.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: That all ended when Guldweitz turned himself in. No one saw it coming, not even the other Flaming Mongrels.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: He's due to give testimony in exchange for a reduced sentence. And not just about the crimes he committed himself, either. All of the gangs he's had dealings with have ample reason to silence him before he spills his secrets.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: He's currently being held in the Moraby Drydocks. Your job is to see that he reaches Limsa in one piece.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: So, you want us to act as bodyguards to a criminal? I don't like the sound of that.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: We'd be protecting the information that's in his head, which could be used to bring countless other lawbreakers to justice. It sounds like a worthwhile cause to me.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: It is. And before you ask why we're hiring outsiders, it's to avoid attention. If I pull too many Yellowjackets from their posts, the gangs'll figure out what's going on.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Better to give the impression that it's business as usual while using professionals like you to escort him in secret.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: We still need to secure the route, so I'll go on ahead and see to the preparations. Come and find me at the Drydocks when you're ready.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Before we begin, we should find out more about this Guldweitz. While it's important to place our trust in the client, I don't want to repeat the mistake we made last time.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: We've been tricked before and I'll not have it happen again. If you find any information on Guldweitz, let me know.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: This Guldweitz has garnered quite the reputation for himself. It seems Futag Yafutag was telling the truth.

dialogue.name: AHLDSKYF
dialogue.text: If the rumors are true, the Flaming Mongrels are involved in most of the moneylending and extortion that goes on in this city. Guldweitz was at the center of this web, overseeing every aspect of these clandestine activities.

dialogue.name: AHLDSKYF
dialogue.text: Now that he has finally found the decency to give himself up, I imagine that his former associates would rather he kept quiet concerning their dealings.

dialogue.name: JNASSHYM
dialogue.text: Oh yes, everybody has heard of the Flaming Mongrels. Their modus operandi is to offer loans, increase the interest to the extent that their mark has no hope of ever paying it back, and then forcing that poor soul to obey their every whim!

dialogue.name: SUNDHIMAL
dialogue.text: I am not at liberty to discuss an ongoing investigation. I can say, however, that many Yellowjackets believe heartless curs like Guldweitz deserve nothing less than death.

dialogue.name: SUNDHIMAL
dialogue.text: He and his rogues have left only tragedy and despair in their wake. Mercy would be a waste.

dialogue.name: AHLDSKYF
dialogue.text: If he testifies, his life will scarce be worth living. Whether in gaol or roaming free, he will be hounded mercilessly until the day he dies. I almost feel sorry for the scoundrel. Almost.

dialogue.name: JNASSHYM
dialogue.text: I hasten to add that I and the Brugaire Consortium have had no illicit transactions with the Flaming Mongrels or any other gang. Perish the thought!

dialogue.name: SUNDHIMAL
dialogue.text: I am all for having Guldweitz spill his secrets, provided that he is put to death immediately after.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Did you hear anything useful?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Yes. It's just as Futag Yafutag said. Guldweitz certainly has a lot of enemies on both sides of the law.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Radovan, it's not too late to refuse. Think about what you're doing!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Trust me, I have. Now, let's say no more on the matter. We have a job to do.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: We can't let anyone get between us and Guldweitz. If he dies, it's all for naught.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: I expect he'll be in fetters, but I'll still be keeping an eye on him. If he tries to escape, I'll make him regret it!

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: All set? Good. Then it's time to bring out the prisoner.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: I present Guldweitz, scourge of Limsa Lominsa. His life's in your hands now. Guard him well.

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: Thank ye kindly.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Hmm? Are you sure you've got the right man?

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Quite sure. Now, listen carefully─this is important. We've scouted the road ahead and we've spotted a group of unsavory figures lying in wait. The plan is to put them down and rush past before anyone realizes what's happened.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Well...if that's how you'd prefer us to handle it, then very well. But we'll need someone to take the lead and cut through their ambush.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: I choose you for that role, Forename. Show me how far you've come as a gunbreaker!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: The rest of us will stay close to Guldweitz and fend off any that try to flank us. Futag, I give you my word that we'll get him to Limsa Lominsa, even if I have to carry him there.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: We're depending on you, Forename. Once you've cleared a path, we'll be right behind you. We'll regroup at Oschon's Embrace and assess the situation before moving on.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Cutting a swath through enemy lines, striking where they're most vulnerable before they have a chance to counterattack─this is where gunbreakers excel.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Don't push yourself too hard. If things take a turn for the worse, fall back.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: I'd go with you if I could, but my first responsibility is to keep Guldweitz alive. Radovan's orders!

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: I 'preciate what yer doin' for me, lasslad.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Think you can stop us?

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Kill 'er'im!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: A pretty poor attempt at an ambush. Without the element of surprise, they're nothing.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Yes, very impressive, but I'll save my thanks until we reach Limsa, if you don't mind.

dialogue.name: ROEGADYNYELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: I bring bad news, I'm afraid. Those men weren't here to ambush you, they were only lookouts. The bulk of the enemy force lies ahead. We'll take the prisoner to a safe hiding place until those rogues have been dealt with.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: What!? Why wasn't I informed sooner?

dialogue.name: ROEGADYNYELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: We only just received the information ourselves. I'm to take the prisoner into custody, while you are to return to your post until further notice. As for the hirelings, their services are no longer required.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Now hold on a moment!

dialogue.name: ROEGADYNYELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: Look, if you've got a problem, take it up with Commodore Reyner. They're his orders, not mine.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: All right, you've made your point.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Well, that's that, I suppose. Nevertheless, I'll see that you receive the full amount, as agreed. It was a pleasure working with you.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Hmm... Something about this doesn't add up. Surely it would make more sense for Futag to go with them? Besides, our agreement was to see Guldweitz to Limsa Lominsa, and that's exactly what I intend to do. You two, come with me.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> It looks like the shoe's on the other foot this time, so I can hardly refuse. Come on, before he does something we'll regret.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: This is her idea of a safe hiding place?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: She took him inside. If my guess is correct, there's no time to waste!

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Nothing for it but to follow him, I suppose.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Stop this at once!

dialogue.name: ROEGADYNYELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: Stay out of it, sellsword! My friend's dead because of this filth! He's got no right to live, so why would you protect him!?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Because I gave my word.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Though he may be beyond redemption, he acts not for his own sake, but for the good of others.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: His testimony will make Limsa Lominsa a safer place.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Now, lower your axe.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Thank the Twelve you got here when you did. It didn't take long for us to find out it was all a ruse, but by then, she'd already bought enough time to carry out her plan. Luckily for us, the three of you weren't so easily duped.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: Of course, she's not the only Yellowjacket to bear a grudge against Guldweitz. But I never thought any of us would go to such lengths. <sigh> A fine bloody mess this is...

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: While we may have been waylaid somewhat, our orders to escort Guldweitz still stand.

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: Afore we go, I want to thank ye for all ye've done.

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: Truth is, I ain't got long to live. Even if I can escape 'avin' me 'ead lopped off, the sickness'll get me sure enough.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: You could've lived out your days as one of the leading figures in the underworld, rich and powerful. What made you turn yourself in?

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: Since afore I can remember, I've been cheatin' and killin' to put food in me belly an' gil in me pocket. An' I was good at it, too. Worked me way to the top. But the top of what? A bunch of liars, swindlers, an' murderers.

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: An' when I found out I only 'ave a few moons left, I realized─ Limsa's the way it is because of people like me. It ain't gotta be that way, though. Not if I say my piece.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: In that case, we'd best get you to Limsa. Posthaste.

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: Aye, afore I kick the bucket. Lead the way.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: I'm glad our part's over, but I wonder what will happen to Guldweitz?

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: That was rather more eventful than I'd anticipated. I must say, however, that you and yours performed admirably.

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: Ye've done right by me. For that, I thank ye.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Not the most direct route, but we got here in the end.

dialogue.name: FUTAGYAFUTAG
dialogue.text: All that remains is for Guldweitz to give his testimony. On behalf of the Yellowjackets, I offer my thanks.

dialogue.name: GULDWEITZ
dialogue.text: Ye've kept your word. Now it's my turn. Fare ye well.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Hmm... Every city has its problems, this one more than most. It is high time we moved on.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Seeing as we've been to Ala Mhigo, Gridania, Ul'dah, and Limsa Lominsa, that just leaves Ishgard... <sigh> I don't exactly thrive in cold climates, though.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Just get yourself a decent overcoat, and you'll be fine. Well then, let's be off.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Brrr! Why would anyone want to live here? Even with these thick clothes, I'm f-f-frozen to the bone!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: I'll admit, it's a fair bit colder than I was expecting. Not that it's anything to be concerned about.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: That's easy for you to s-s-say!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: You'll soon get used to it, I'm sure. Anyway, Forename, it seems that instead of offering work via an Adventurers' Guild, Ishgard's Temple Knights issue leves.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Although there do not appear to be any clients in need of protection, it is only a matter of time before something comes our way. Until then, be sure not to let your skills, or your gunblade, grow rusty.
